results.title: Rhinoceros
results.creator_credit: Tom O'Horgan, Ely Landau, American Express Films and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
A satirical comedy about bored and alcoholic office worker Stanley (Gene Wilder) and his friend John (Zero Mostel) who bare witness to a strange ‘illness’ in which fellow human beings slowly turn into Rhinos. A film rendition of Eugene Ionesco’s play, part of Theater of the Absurd, “Rhinoceros” looks to explore the themes of conformity in society and keeping-up-appearances. Will Stanley be able to resist becoming one of the herd and maintain his individuality? This low budget film has some compelling performances, particularly that of Mostel when he makes his transition to the animal kingdom and some wacky black comedy situations, such as a stampede of Rhinos (that are left to the imagination to see) that take out the stairs of the office leaving Stanley and his workmates stranded. Stanley has his own particularly simple attitude: “I’m indifferent to life, so I take a few drinks and then it doesn’t bother me anymore.” Cast includes Karen Black, Joe Silver, Robert Weil.

results.title: Eugene O'Neill's: The Iceman cometh
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Ely Landau, American Express Films and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
In this searing film adaptation of Eugene O’Neill’s play, Robert Ryan stars as Larry, a barfly and self proclaimed philosopher eagerly awaiting death all but for his iron constitution. He and his gang of drunk cronies anticipate the periodical visit of Hickey (Lee Marvin) who usually turns up in a generous mood and with generous purse for the bar owner Harry (Frederic March) and the whole gang. This time, however, he is late in arriving and everyone is on edge and the anticipation of the bender they are about to go on is rousing them out of their alcoholic stupor. Hickey’s visit doesn’t bring them the fun they were hoping for; he instead challenges them all to forget their hopes and dreams and deal with reality. He is especially hard on Larry but his words affect more deeply the young Don Parritt (Jeff Bridges) whose relationship with his mother is a reality too hard for him to bear.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Frankenheimer, Ely Landau, American Express Films and Ely Landau Organization

results.title: The Swindle = Il Bidone
results.brief_description: Three small time confidence tricksters unite to try and get money by robing the poor. “Il Bidone” is crime-doesn’t-pay film with a realistic starkness only Fellini could instigate. Strong performances play out in a harsh setting and with dire consequences for the main protagonist Augusto (Broderick Crawford) as he tries to help his estranged daughter with money to attend college but ends up betrayed by those who, like him, are swindlers up to no good. The second film in Fellini’s so called trilogy about loneliness (which include “La Strada” and “Le Notti di Cabiria”). Cast includes: Giulietta Masina, Richard Basehart, Franco Fabrizi.

results.title: The Idol = L'Idole
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: Directed by Australian Samantha Lang (The Monkey’s mask), this is a tale of two different souls who find solace in each other - and a kind of obsession. Set in Paris, France in an apartment block with a winding staircase that binds the people who live there. In an empty apartment opposite the elderly resident of Chinese origin called Zao (James Hong) arrives the beautiful and melodramatic Sarah (Leelee Sobieski), a young theatre actress from Australia. Sarah wants to feign a suicide to scandalise her relationship with her married lover but until she does the deed Zao asks that he may cook for her. Together they face the prospect of the end of life, love and sexual yearning - and an enjoyment of good food. Based on the novel “A L’Heure Dite” by Michelle Tourneur.

results.title: Till human voices wake us
results.creator_credit: Michael Petroni, David Redman, Dean Murphy, Matthias Emcke, Nigel Odell, Shana Levine, Thomas Augsberger, AFFC, Cinemedia, Entertainment Finance Group, Globe Film Company and Instinct Entertainment
results.brief_description: Lyrical and moody, a reflective piece about first love, love lost and memories. Initially set in the 1960s in a small Victorian country town, a teenage boy returns home from boarding school to his father, the town doctor, and his best friend Silvy. On the night of the town dance Sam and Silvy slip away to go for a swim, unfortunately with dire consequences. Twenty years later Sam (Guy Pearce), now a psychologist, returns to fulfil his father’s final wish to be buried in Genoa. He meets a strange woman called Ruby (Helena Bonham-Carter) on the train and she proves to be a link for Sam back to his Silvy and his lost emotions. Written and directed by Michael Petroni in his feature film debut with original music composed by Dale Cornelius. Cast includes Frank Gallacher, Lindley Joyner, Brooke Harman.

results.title: Bed and board = Domicile conjugal
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Marcel Berbert, Fida Cinematografica, Films du Carrosse and Valoria
results.brief_description: Fourth instalment in Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” series depicts the still somewhat immature Antoine facing the birth of his first child, infatuation with a Japanese woman and the petty squabbles of married life. Whilst perhaps not as well realised as “Stolen kisses”, “Bed and board” nevertheless maintains a laconic charm, aided by the redoubtable Truffaut mainstay, Jean-Pierre Leaud.

results.title: Father of the bride. Part II
results.creator_credit: Charles Shyer, Nancy Meyers and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “Father of the bride” (199), itself a remake of the 1950 Vincente Minnelli film starring Elizabeth Taylor, Steve Martin reprises his role as George Banks. This time the hapless George must face becoming a grandfather, (news which triggers a mid-life crisis). along with the alarming fact that he is to be a father again. Cast includes Diane Keaton, Martin Short, Kimberly Williams, George Newbern, Kieran Culkin.

results.title: Madame Sata
results.creator_credit: Karim Ainouz, Donald Ranvaud, Isabel Diegues, Juliette Renaud, Marc Beauchamps, Mauricio Andrade Ramos, Vincent Marava, Walter Salles, Lumière, Video Filmes and Wild Bunch
results.brief_description: Set in the seedy underworld of Rio in the 1930s, this is the story of “Madam Sata” or Joao Francisco dos Santos (1900-76) a man born to the streets, who lives with a whore, her daughter and Tabu, the family slave. Fraternising in petty crime, Joao becomes drawn to the stage, and develops an exotic show, replete with elaborate costumes and erotic themes. But Joao’s temper and talents with a switchblade, land him in constant strife. This bio-pic, directed by Karim Ainouz, is an exciting and gritty presentation of a paradoxical personality; he lays bare the realities and squalor of poverty whilst bringing all the glamour of performance art to the screen. The central performance by Lazaro Ramos, is compelling and convincing, bringing Joao’s vitality, flamboyance and commanding presence to life. Cast also includes: Marcelia Cartaxo, Flavio Bauraqui, Felippe Marques and Emiliano Querioz.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karim Ainouz, Donald Ranvaud, Isabel Diegues, Juliette Renaud, Marc Beauchamps, Mauricio Andrade Ramos, Vincent Marava, Walter Salles, Lumière, Video Filmes and Wild Bunch

results.title: The Iron ladies
results.brief_description: Camp comedy, based on a true story, about a group of gay and transsexual men who join a volleyball team and are led to victory by an unassuming but determined coach. Drawing comic conflict from the protagonists preening and interpersonal problems, the film travels a fairly standard arch regarding tolerance difference and overcoming seemingly insurmountable odds. A huge hit in Thailand, this film also played in numerous festivals, including Toronto Film Festival. Followed by a sequel The Iron ladies 2 in 2003.

results.title: The Age of innocence [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Barbara de Fina, Cappa and De Fina
results.brief_description: Trapped within New York’s 19th Century high society, a time of lavish excess and social hypocrisy, Newland Archer (Daniel Day-Lewis) is caught between two women and two worlds - his lovely fiancee May Welland (Winona Ryder) and the world he knows, and the scandalous Countess Olenska (Michelle Pfeiffer) and the world he dreams of having. Based on Edith Wharton’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel, “The Age of innocence” is the quintessential story of forbidden love, luminous with passion, temptation, intrigue and sacrifice. Also available on VHS [305955].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Scorsese, Barbara de Fina, Cappa and De Fina

description_for_label: Trapped within New York’s 19th Century high society, a time of lavish excess and social hypocrisy, Newland Archer (Daniel Day-Lewis) is caught between two women and two worlds - his lovely fiancee May Welland (Winona Ryder) and the world he knows, and the scandalous Countess Olenska (Michelle Pfeiffer) and the world he dreams of having. Based on Edith Wharton’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel, “The Age of innocence” is the quintessential story of forbidden love, luminous with passion, temptation, intrigue and sacrifice. Also available on VHS [305955].
